title: Ticket #429: Grid monitor improvements for BNL ATLAS
description:
The BNL ATLAS group has been encountering problems with the grid monitor, particularly when failures are encountered. Our investigation has revealed a number of improvements that can be made to the grid monitor which would benefit both them and other users.

The proposed changes are summarized here. Many of them can be made independently of each other. As changes are made, test binaries can be made available for BNL to try. As changes are tested and more debugging of failures collected, this list may change.

  • Grid monitor retry interval made configurable. DONE
  • Gridmanager receives callbacks on grid monitor job status from jobmanager. DONE
  • On startup, grid monitor reads last status file of previous grid monitor and caches completed jobs. DONE
  • Grid monitor lives longer, lifetime configurable?
  • Grid monitor clears cache of completed jobs which no longer have state files. (important if grid monitor lives longer or reads older status file) DONE
  • Don't give up on grid monitor job after 5 minutes. DONE
  • Cancel grid monitor job when gridmanager gives up on it. DONE
  • Don't leave jobmanagers alive when grid monitor is down.
  • Better globus-url-copy error handling
    • Retry failed g-u-c with altered X509_CERT_DIR only on first attempt. DONE
    • Retry all all failures, not just timeout. DONE
    • Make timeout shorter.
    • Log output of g-u-c.
    • Kill hanging g-u-c processes. DONE
  • Grid monitor outer script sends heartbeat more reliably. Eliminate blocking calls that may delay it significantly. DONE
  • Improve retention of grid monitor log by gridmanager.
  • Backup retrieval of grid monitor log after job completion/failure?
  • The gridmanager classad should include grid monitor statistics, last time we heard from the gridmonitor (is it running?) and the last time it successfully read job information from the remote scheduler (is it successfully getting job status info?)
